title: British Embassy in Algiers seeks bids for climate fund
lead: It intends to support activities in Algeria that focus on raising public awareness about climate change as well as solutions for a green recovery post COVID-19

title: Human activity ‘could drive atmospheric CO2 in 2021 50% higher than pre-industrial levels’
lead: The UK’s national weather service attributes the rise mainly to fossil fuel burning and deforestation

title: Government faces backlash over decision to approve use of ‘bee-killing’ pesticide
lead: The EU had previously imposed a ban on the use of the pesticide

title: US awards $20m for advanced nuclear reactor concepts
lead: The latest programme aims to assist the progression of advanced reactor designs in their earliest phases

title: Welsh health boards granted additional £10m for energy efficiency and renewables
lead: The funding will support energy projects being delivered by Swansea Bay University Health Board, Cardiff and Vale University Health Board and the Hywel Dda University Health Board

title: Pakistan suffers massive nationwide blackout leaving millions of people in the dark
lead: The power cut lasted more than 15 hours, affecting large cities including Islamabad, Lahore and Multan

title: Highways England to study link between road water and microplastics
lead: It is expected to help the government company to better understand the scale of the issue, the nature of the problem and identify any further detailed research to inform changes to its current policy or design standards

title: Waste criminal ordered to pay £2.1m for illegal site
lead: John Bruce, aged 48 from Pershore, has been given three months to pay the fine or face seven years in jail

title: Scottish communities granted £3.2m for climate action projects
lead: The Community Climate Asset Fund is supporting 279 projects, which includes the delivery of electric bikes, food growing equipment to reduce carbon emission and glazing to boost energy efficiency

title: Average household energy bills in 2020 ‘fell to the lowest level since 2017’
lead: The average energy bills of UK households in 2020 dropped by £172 from 2019, according to new research
